title: Requires leases in N.Y. city to contain a rider concerning the rights and duties with regards to the housing part of court
summary: Requires leases in cities with a population of one million or more to contain a rider describing the rights and duties with regards to the housing part of such city's housing part of civil court; directs the office of court administration to conduct a public information program informing tenants of their rights and of the right to utilize the housing of the civil court.

       Introduced  by  Sens.  MONTGOMERY, HASSELL-THOMPSON, KRUEGER, SERRANO --
         read twice and ordered printed, and when printed to  be  committed  to
         the Committee on Judiciary

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  real property law, in relation to notice of the
         rights and duties of owners and tenants in cities with a population of
         one million or more

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  real property law is amended by adding a new section
    2  235-h to read as follows:
    3    S 235-H. RIGHTS AND DUTIES OF OWNERS AND TENANTS.  1. IN CITIES WITH A
    4  POPULATION OF ONE MILLION OR MORE, EACH OWNER  OF RESIDENTIAL REAL PROP-
    5  ERTY SHALL FURNISH TO EACH TENANT SIGNING A  NEW  OR  RENEWAL  LEASE,  A
    6  RIDER  DESCRIBING  THE  RIGHTS  AND  DUTIES OF OWNERS AND TENANTS IN THE
    7  HOUSING PART OF THE CIVIL COURT IN SUCH  CITY.  SUCH  PUBLICATION  SHALL
    8  CONFORM  TO  THE  INTENT OF SECTION 5-702 OF THE GENERAL OBLIGATIONS LAW
    9  AND SHALL BE ATTACHED AS AN ADDENDUM TO THE LEASE. UPON THE FACE OF EACH
   10  LEASE, IN BOLD PRINT, SHALL APPEAR THE FOLLOWING:    "ATTACHED  TO  THIS
   11  LEASE  ARE  THE  PERTINENT  RULES  AND REGULATIONS GOVERNING TENANTS AND
   12  LANDLORDS' RIGHTS WITH REGARDS TO THE HOUSING PART OF THE CIVIL COURT".
   13    2. THE RIDER SHALL BE IN A FORM PROMULGATED BY  THE  OFFICE  OF  COURT
   14  ADMINISTRATION  IN  LARGER  TYPE THAN THE LEASE AND SHALL BE UTILIZED AS
   15  PROVIDED IN SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION.
   16    3. THE OFFICE OF COURT ADMINISTRATION SHALL PREPARE  AND  IMPLEMENT  A
   17  PUBLIC  EDUCATION  CAMPAIGN,  USING  THE  WRITTEN MEDIA, RADIO AND TELE-
   18  VISION, THE PURPOSE OF WHICH SHALL BE TO INFORM TENANTS OF ALL OF  THEIR
   19  RIGHTS  AS  TENANTS, AND OF THE AVAILABILITY OF THE HOUSING PART OF SUCH
   20  CITY'S CIVIL COURT SHOULD THEY BE AGGRIEVED.
   21    S 2. This act shall take effect on the sixtieth  day  after  it  shall
   22  have become a law.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01410-01-1
